title: NACC Uniform Data Set (UDS) - INITIAL VISIT PACKETFORM B5: BEHAVIORAL ASSESSMENT Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire (NPI-Q[1])
description: INSTRUCTIONS: This form is to be completed by the clinician or other trained health professional based on co-participant interview, as described by the training video. (This is not to be completed by the subject as a paper-and-pencil self-report.) For information on NPI-Q Interviewer Certification, see UDS Coding Guidebook for Initial Visit Packet, Form B5. Link to NACC Coding Guidebook

npiqinfx.title: 1a If NPI CO-PARTICIPANT other-specify
npiqinfx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes ('), double quotes ("), ampersands (&), and percentage signs (%).)

del.title: 2a. Delusions - Does the patient have false beliefs, such as thinking that others are stealing from him/her or planning to harm him/her in some way?

delsev.title: 2b. If Delusions, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

hall.title: 3a. Hallucinations - Does the patient have hallucinations such as false visions or voices? Does he or she seem to hear or see things that are not present?

hallsev.title: 3b. If Hallucinations, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

agit.title: 4a. Agitation/aggression - Is the patient resistive to help from others at times, or hard to handle?

agitsev.title: 4b. If Agitation/agression, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

depd.title: 5a. Depression/dysphoria - Does the patient seem sad or say that he/she is depressed?

depdsev.title: 5b. If Depression/dysphoria, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

anx.title: 6a. Anxiety - Does the patient become upset when separated from you? Does he/she have any other signs of nervousness, such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?

anxsev.title: 6b. If Anxiety, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

elat.title: 7a. Elation/euphoria - Does the patient appear to feel too good or act excessively happy?

elatsev.title: 7b. If Elation/euphoria, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

apa.title: 8a. Apathy/indifference - Does the patient seem less interested in his/her usual activities or in the activities and plans of others?

apasev.title: 8b. If Apathy/indifference, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

disn.title: 9a. Disinhibition - Does the patient seem to act impulsively, for example, talking to strangers as if he/she knows them, or saying things that may hurt people's feelings?

disnsev.title: 9b. If Disinhibition, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

irr.title: 10a. Irritability/lability - Is the patient impatient and cranky? Does he/she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?

irrsev.title: 10b. If Irritability/lability, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

mot.title: 11a. Motor disturbance - Does the patient engage in repetitive activities such as pacing around the house,handling buttons, wrapping string, or doing other things repeatedly?

motsev.title: 11b. If Motor disturbance, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

nite.title: 12a. Nighttime behaviors - Does the patient awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning, or take excessive naps during the day?

nitesev.title: 12b. If Nighttime behaviors, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

app.title: 13a. Appetite/eating - Has the patient lost or gained weight, or had a change in the type of food he/she likes?

appsev.title: 13b. If Appetite/eating, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

del.title: 2a. Delusions - Does the patient have false beliefs, such as thinking that others are stealing from him/her or planning to harm him/her in some way?

hall.title: 3a. Hallucinations - Does the patient have hallucinations such as false visions or voices? Does he or she seem to hear or see things that are not present?

agit.title: 4a. Agitation/aggression - Is the patient resistive to help from others at times, or hard to handle?

depd.title: 5a. Depression/dysphoria - Does the patient seem sad or say that he/she is depressed?

anx.title: 6a. Anxiety - Does the patient become upset when separated from you? Does he/she have any other signs of nervousness, such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?

elat.title: 7a. Elation/euphoria - Does the patient appear to feel too good or act excessively happy?

apa.title: 8a. Apathy/indifference - Does the patient seem less interested in his/her usual activities or in the activities and plans of others?

disn.title: 9a. Disinhibition - Does the patient seem to act impulsively, for example, talking to strangers as if he/she knows them, or saying things that may hurt people's feelings?

irr.title: 10a. Irritability/lability - Is the patient impatient and cranky? Does he/she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?

mot.title: 11a. Motor disturbance - Does the patient engage in repetitive activities such as pacing around the house,handling buttons, wrapping string, or doing other things repeatedly?

nite.title: 12a. Nighttime behaviors - Does the patient awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning, or take excessive naps during the day?

app.title: 13a. Appetite/eating - Has the patient lost or gained weight, or had a change in the type of food he/she likes?
